105951.name: Special Permit: The Expansion Pack for Cabela's Big Game Hunter
105951.description:
Special Permit is the expansion pack created for the original Cabela's Big Game Hunter on Microsoft Windows.
It features new animals, 23 new stands, a new world, 9 new weapons, new camps, a new target range and an all new video.

Source: Wikipedia, "Special Permit: The Expansion Pack for Cabela's Big Game Hunter", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

105952.name: Cabela's Big Game Hunter II

videogameexpansion.105953: Cabela's Big Game Hunter II: Open Season

105952.description:
User Summary

Cabela's Big Game Hunter II is the first sequel to Cabela's Big Game Hunter. The player hunts 18 different species throughout locations in North America and Africa.

105953.name: Cabela's Big Game Hunter II: Open Season
105953.description:
Cabela's Big Game Hunter II: Open Season is the expansion pack for Cabela's Big Game Hunter II. Released in 1998 by HeadGames Publishing, Inc. it features a range of new weapons, ammunition, animals, authentic Cabela's hunting gear and a new map

Source: Wikipedia, "Cabela's Big Game Hunter II: Open Season", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

105954.name: Cabela's Big Game Hunter III

videogameexpansion.105955: Cabela's Big Game Hunter III: The Next Harvest

105954.description:
User Summary

Cabela's Big Game Hunter III is the second sequel to Cabela's Big Game Hunter. The game features new North American settings in which the player hunts 11 different species while avoiding several endangered, protected species. Also incorporated into the game are a variety of tests on survival, hunting safety and ethics.

105955.name: Cabela's Big Game Hunter III: The Next Harvest
105955.description:
User Summary

The Next Harvest is the expansion pack for Cabela's Big Game Hunter III. As with previous Cabela's Big Game Hunter games, it adds new huntable species, more guns and more hunting gear.

105956.name: Cabela's Big Game Hunter 4
105956.description:
User Summary

Cabela's Big Game Hunter 4 is the third sequel to Cabela's Big Game Hunter. The game features new North American locations in which the player hunts the 9 huntable species among the games 24 species. Available to the player are a wide selection of fire arms and all manner of hunting and outdoor equipment.

105957.name: Steel Horizon
105957.description:
The game takes place at sea, during World War II, where the player, an American captain, commands allied fores against opponents. The game also features a multiplayer mode where players can battle rival players.

There are several different playable ships. These include battleships, aircraft carriers, submarines, destroyers, battlecruisers, cruisers, PT boats, repair ships, cargo ships, landing craft and minelayers. Every ship has a special move that can be triggered during tactical battle.

Source: Wikipedia, "Steel Horizon", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

105958.name: Alpha Waves
105958.description:
From the back of the box:

Alpha Waves

They have created the dream machine...

Your passport to a new world: VIRTUAL REALITY.
The programme: explore a labyrinth of waves and light, discover the mechanics of dreams and challenge the power of the ALPHA waves. An hallucinating experience, rich in unreal sensations, so far unknown.


2 modes: Emotion/Arcade
256 rooms to discover
Universe in real time 3D
1 or 2 players simultaneously
100% New Age

105959.description:
Publisher blurb to be added here

Ahmad Hassan introduces a new vampire and a new color combination to Nightfall. With Ahmad's In Play text, your opponents will be forced to risk taking damage themselves just to attack you!

The pack comes pre-wrapped with:

1 Ahmad Hassan draft card
7 Ahmad Hassan cards




The card divider for this card comes with the Nightfall: Martial Law box.
105959.name: Nightfall: Ahmad Hassan Promo

105960.description:
Publisher blurb to be added here

Desperate Measures introduces a new action and a new color combination to Nightfall. Its Feed effect can help you hunt down that c-c-combo card you're searching for, but be wary of the cost!

The pack comes pre-wrapped with:

1 Desperate Measures draft card
7 Desperate Measures cards




The card divider for this card comes with the Nightfall: Martial Law box.
105960.name: Nightfall: Desperate Measures Promo

105961.description:
Publisher blurb to be added here

"Pale Fury" introduces a huge new lycanthrope to Nightfall. Be careful however, as a minion as powerful as "Pale Fury" is difficult to control, often causing destruction among his own ranks!

The pack comes pre-wrapped with:

1 Pale Fury draft card
7 Pale Fury cards




The card divider for this card comes with the Nightfall: Martial Law box.
105961.name: Nightfall: Pale Fury Promo

105962.name: Steal Princess
105962.description:
Steal Princess is a puzzle-based platform game. The game is divided into larger areas that are subdivided into multiple levels. Levels are short and generally only take a few minutes to complete. The goal often involves defeating a set of enemies and activating switches in order to gain access to the level's exit. The puzzle elements in the first few levels combine to form more complex puzzles as the game progresses. There is also a level editor feature to allow players to create their own puzzles and share them on the Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection network.

Source: Wikipedia, "Steal Princess", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

105963.name: Travian
105963.description:
User Summary

Travian is a real time strategy browser game set in a world with several (thousand) players.

The game is centered on building villages, form alliances and going to war. In order to build buildings you need four resources: wood, clay, iron, and grain. The raw materials are extracted from fields and mines, which can continuously be upgraded to increase production. Similarly, you can build many different buildings, each with their own special task.

The game is played on servers which have a limited lifetime. Late in the game it is possible to build a wonder of the world and whichever alliance builds this first is declared the winner. At this point the server ends, so it can be restarted later.

105965.name: Speed Racer
105965.description:
Speed Racer is a tie-in to the 2008 film adaptation of the same name. The actors from the movie reprise their role of their video game counterparts.
The game is a racing game in the vein of the F-Zero series, including tracks full of odd twists, turns and loops impossible by realistic standards, set in five vibrant, exotic locations. The goal of the game is not only to win first place in each race, but also to have the most points by the end of the cup to win the competition. Points can be earned by placing high during races, but also by performing stunts and, most commonly, bashing into and destroying other racers with the use of car acrobatics.

Source: Wikipedia, "Speed Racer (2008 video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

105966.name: Battle Fish
105966.description:
'User Summary

Upgrade your fish to make it a more effective warrior, release bubbles to heal the fish, but beware, you may heal your enemies as well.

105967.name: Speed Racer  (Handheld)
105967.description:
Speed Racer is a tie-in to the 2008 film adaptation of the same name. The actors from the movie reprise their role of their video game counterparts.
The game is a racing game in the vein of the F-Zero series, including tracks full of odd twists, turns and loops impossible by realistic standards, set in five vibrant, exotic locations. The goal of the game is not only to win first place in each race, but also to have the most points by the end of the cup to win the competition. Points can be earned by placing high during races, but also by performing stunts and, most commonly, bashing into and destroying other racers with the use of car acrobatics.

Source: Wikipedia, "Speed Racer (2008 video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

105968.name: Black 2
105968.description:
User Summary

An overhead shooter. You have access to a lot of weapons, and slow motion.

105969.name: Blood Car! 2000! Deluxe!
105969.description:
User Summary

An upgraded version of Blood Car 2000. Run over pedestrians, or race against time.

105970.name: Abduction!
105970.description:
User Summary

You control aliens trying to capture and grind up humans and other animals on earth. Upgrade your ship to make it more effective.

105971.name: Achievement Unlocked 2
105971.description:
User Summary

A weird platforming game where the focus is on unlocking various achievements.

105973.name: Spyro: Shadow Legacy
105973.description:
Spyro: Shadow Legacy (known during development as Spyro: Action & RPG Light) is the fifth handheld game and tenth installment in the original Spyro the Dragon series of video games. It is a hybrid action/RPG game designed for the Nintendo DS and takes place after Spyro: A Hero's Tail. It is the final game in the original continuity; as the games released afterward, The Legend of Spyro: A New Beginning, and its subsequent sequels; serve as a reboot of the series.

Source: Wikipedia, "Spyro: Shadow Legacy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

105974.name: Ranma 1/2: Hard Battle
105974.description:
User Summary

Ranma 1/2: Hard Battle is a 2D fighting game based on the anime series Ranma 1/2. It is the only Ranma 1/2 game to be translated for American audiences.

The story for the game is that Principal Kouchou is promising others favors if they fight each other. Thus, chaos ensues and all of the characters are eager to fight!

The gameplay is quite similar to other 2D fighting games that were released in the early nineties. Every character has their own move set and unique characteristics, and post-fight dialogue. For the US version of the game, a lot of character names were changed.

The game includes a Story mode, VS mode, and Team Challenge (5-on-5 battle) mode.

There are twelve playable characters from the anime series: Ranma, Ranma-Chan, Akane, Shampoo, Mousse, Ukyou, Genma, Gosunkugi, King, Ryouga, Pantyhose Tarou, Pantyhose Tarou (Transformed), and Happousai.

105975.name: Enchanted Forest
105975.description:
The Enchanted Forest games are games of exploration, adventure, and fantasy. Your mission is to venture into the depths of an enchanted forest, triumph over its perils, and acquire its riches. No two games are the same, so there's no end to the fun. Its scoring system lets you keep track of your personal scores as well as compete with the other players on the web. The Enchanted Forest games are free and do not require Java. Are you ready for the challenge?

Source: The Game Website.

105977.name: AGL: Murkon's Refuge
105977.description:
The traitorous First Mage Murkon has absconded with a great magic and thrown two great kingdoms into political uproar. Can you brave Murkon's sprawling labyrinth, conquer his minions, defeat him in battle, and recover the lost magic?

Welcome to Murkon's Refuge, a computer role-playing game with over a hundred types of foes, hundreds of items of equipment and magic, and a devilishly tricky landscape. Can you assemble a team of knights, wizards, rogues, and others with enough skills between them to conquer the challenges Murkon will set before you?

Source: The Developer Website.

105978.name: AGL: Murkon's Vengeance
105978.description:
Welcome to Murkon's Vengeance, a reverse role-playing game where YOU are the badguy, and bands of heroic adventurers are your enemies. Summon monsters to assist you in ascending through ten hero-infested dungeon levels and wreak your revenge on those who ran off with your rightfully stolen magic talisman and left you for dead.

It is not necessary to have played the prequel game, Murkon's Refuge, before playing this one, but you will probably get more out of both games if you play them in order.

Source: The Developer Website.

105979.name: AGL: Monster Arena
105979.description:
Train your own team of warriors and plunge them into combat in the Monster Arena against other players as well as computer-generated opponents. Reap the spoils of battle and outfit your team for the next.
Monster Arena is a competitive combat game that takes place over several days, beginning fresh on the first of each month (if you register late, you can catch up without disadvantage). Battles take place automatically each night, so each day you can log in, see how your team did, and prepare them for the next fight. Do you have what it takes?

Source: The Developer Website.

105980.name: The Zombie Crisis
105980.description:
User Summary

The 32nd game in the Simple DS series, this an on-rails zombie shooter featuring a combo system.

105981.name: Zoids Saga DS: Legend of Arcadia
105981.description:
User Summary

Zoids Saga DS: Legend of Arcadia is role-playing game for the Nintendo DS that retells the story of the original Zoids Saga game while adding elements from a later Zoids anime, Zoids Genesis. The game has updated graphics and additional aspects such as customizing your Zoids.

105982.name: Zoids Dash
105982.description:
User Summary

Zoids Dash is a mission-based platformer for the Nintendo DS based on the Zoids anime, which is based on the Japanese Zoids toy franchise. Controlling a team of three Zoids, players can collect weapons and upgrade their Zoids as they battle through enemies and bosses.

105983.name: Elf Bowling 1 & 2
105983.description:
User Summary

Elf Bowling 1 & 2 is a compilation that includes the first two Elf Bowling games, Christmas-themed bowling and shuffleboard games originally released for free in web browsers.

105984.name: Zoids Battle Colosseum
105984.description:
User Summary

Zoids Battle Colosseum takes place during the plot of Zoids Dash, where the characters are sucked into a battle Colosseum game and have to fight their way out again. The game features rock-paper-scissors combat.

105985.description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.




This is the fourth character expansion of San Guo Sha, or the Killers of the Three Kingdoms. This expansion introduces 10 new characters including 8 ordinary characters and 2 Demi-God characters randomly inserted into some packets.

The 10 characters are:

Shu Kingdom: Liu Chan, Jiang Wei;
Wei Kingdom: Zhang He, Deng Ai;
Wu Kingdom: Sun Ce, Zhang Zhao&Zhang Hong[1];
Qun: Zuo Ci, Cai Wenji.
Two Demi-God: God Si Mayi, God Zhao Yun.

[1] Zhang Zhao&Zhang Hong are two characters on the same card, like Yan Liang&Wen Zhou in the Fire Expansion）
105985.name: San Guo Sha: Mountain

105986.name: Enough Plumbers
105986.description:
Clones, lots of clones! Create clones, exploit special abilities, then control them all simultaneously in order to reach the end flag in each level.

Source: The Publisher Website.

105987.name: The Bombardier
105987.description:
Australian action game.
Aim your 'bombs' and catapult them into the box. The insert features various holes, just big enough to 'receive' one of your bombs. If your bomb ends in a hole, you score points.
"You'll have explosions of laughter" according to the box.

105988.name: Zoids Saga
105988.description:
User Summary

Zoids Saga is an RPG game for the Game Boy Advance, themed on the Japanese toy franchise, Zoids, and the Zoids anime. Throughout the game, the player can collect parts to improve the party's Zoids. Combat is turn- and grid-based.

105989.name: Catfight
105989.description:
Catfight (also known as Cat Fight and CatFight: The Ultimate Female Fighting Game) is a PC fighting video game developed by Phantom Card and published in 1996 by Atlantean Interactive.
The plot of the game revolves around a dark goddess Shinma and 10 female warriors competing to challenge her and obtain the ultimate power.
Advertisement on the Atlantean Interactive website said:
"Join eleven of the fiercest female warriors from across the Ethers [sic] as they battle it out for the ultimate power of the Universe! Watch the head-to-head fighting assault blaze its way to your screen -- with the hottest women in games engaging in the most violent fighting techniques imaginable! Some of the things you must endure are disembowelment, decapitation, and worse! It's the ultimate life versus death struggle, where you must pulverize your opponent in eight awesome arenas to survive! Here is your chance to claim your place next to the most awesome women in the galaxy!"
Like the early games in the Mortal Kombat series, Catfight uses digitized actors for creating the sprites representing the fighters (the martial actress Katalin Zamiar of the MKII fame portrayed a female ninja character Chae Lee).

Source: Wikipedia, "Catfight (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

105990.name: Ghostbusters: Sanctum of Slime
105990.description:
Ghostbusters: Sanctum of Slime is an action-adventure video game developed by Behaviour Interactive and published by Atari. The game features four-player cooperative gameplay as players control Ghostbusters to defeat enemy ghosts. Ghostbusters: Sanctum of Slime was released on March 23, 2011 for Xbox Live Arcade, PlayStation Network, and Windows.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ghostbusters: Sanctum of Slime", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

105991.name: Shrek Smash n' Crash Racing
105991.description:
Shrek Smash and Crash plays like any other kart video game. The players first must pick from a line-up of thirteen different characters from the Shrek universe. The maximum number of racers on a track is six. Each of the characters have special stats that are not displayed in the game. Any other non-human racers will be controlled by the computer and chosen at random. After the racers are chosen then the player has the option to pick the track or cup tournament they want to play on.
On the tracks are item barrels that contains items inside of them. The items are used as an advantage to help the racer out. The tracks are also filled with obstacles and short-cuts that can either help or harm the racers.

Source: Wikipedia, "Shrek Smash n' Crash Racing", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

105993.name: Shrek Smash n' Crash Racing (Handheld)
105993.description:
Shrek Smash and Crash plays like any other kart video game. The players first must pick from a line-up of thirteen different characters from the Shrek universe. The maximum number of racers on a track is six. Each of the characters have special stats that are not displayed in the game. Any other non-human racers will be controlled by the computer and chosen at random. After the racers are chosen then the player has the option to pick the track or cup tournament they want to play on.
On the tracks are item barrels that contains items inside of them. The items are used as an advantage to help the racer out. The tracks are also filled with obstacles and short-cuts that can either help or harm the racers.

Source: Wikipedia, "Shrek Smash n' Crash Racing", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

105994.name: Zoids: Legacy
105994.description:
User Summary

Zoids: Legacy is the second game in the Zoids Saga series, and the first to be released in English. Released on GBA, Zoids: Legacy is an RPG following story elements of the Zoids anime. A new addition to the series are random encounters.

105996.name: Shaun the Sheep
105996.description:
In Shaun the Sheep, the sheep have escaped and Shaun must find the rest of the flock before the Farmer comes home. Gamers will play as Shaun and interact with favorite characters such as Shirley, Timmy, Bitzer and more as they adventure through their favorite scenes and explore areas from the series like the junk pile, the sheep pool and the circus tent. Players will utilize the DS touch screen and microphone as they experience three different gameplay modes: Story Mode, Mini-game Mode and Collection Mode

Source: Wikipedia, "Shaun the Sheep (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

105997.name: Zoids Saga: Fuzors
105997.description:
User Summary

Zoids Saga: Fuzors is the third game in the Zoids Saga series, and closely follows the storyline of the Zoids: Fuzors anime series. Released for GBA, it is a role-playing game which revolves around getting new parts to upgrade your Zoids.

105998.name: Scooby-Doo! Unmasked
105998.description:
In the game, the player uses Scooby-Doo to take down enemies and collect clues for Velma. Scooby-Doo can change costumes which can give him different moves such as kung-fu and fly like a bat. Without using these costumes some levels may not be possible to finish. This is the third Scooby-Doo game to feature a laugh track.

Source: Wikipedia, "Scooby-Doo! Unmasked", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

105999.name: Zoids Vs.
105999.description:
User Summary

A 3D-fighter based on the Zoids toy franchise, Zoids Vs. was released on Nintendo Gamecube. Allowing two players to team-up against AI or battle it out in huge open-air environments, the gameplay of Zoids Vs's story mode revolves around earning money to upgrade or purchase stronger Zoids to battle with.

106000.name: Scooby-Doo! Unmasked (Handheld)
106000.description:
In the game, the player uses Scooby-Doo to take down enemies and collect clues for Velma. Scooby-Doo can change costumes which can give him different moves such as kung-fu and fly like a bat. Without using these costumes some levels may not be possible to finish. This is the third Scooby-Doo game to feature a laugh track. In the Nintendo DS game, there are a few minigames included to make use of its touchscreen.

Source: Wikipedia, "Scooby-Doo! Unmasked", available under the CC-BY-SA License.
